title: How to Tame a Dog in Minecraft PE

steps.title: Turn off Peaceful difficulty.
steps.content: Turn off Peaceful difficulty. If you're playing on Peaceful difficulty, increase the difficulty until you're done taming your wolf. Wolves will show up in Peaceful mode, but skeletons will not spawn because you need their bones. Once tamed, the dog will not disappear when you change the difficulty back but will follow and teleport loyally to you.

steps.title: Gather several bones.
steps.content: Gather several bones. You can find bones in Survival mode by killing skeletons, or by opening chests in desert and jungle temples. Gather at least 5 bones for each wolf you plan to tame, and preferably 10 to be safe. While you're hunting skeletons, kill zombies as well and gather rotten meat. This comes in handy to feed your dog but this isn't the best food for them; as Rabbit Stew is. Rotten flesh cannot be used in taming, it may be convincing when they are begging but all it will do it breed an untamed wolf. If you're in Creative mode, just add one to your inventory.

steps.title: Find a wild wolf.
steps.content: Find a wild wolf. Wolves can be found in forest and taiga biomes, usually near spruce trees. They are not hostile unless you hit them. If you don't mind starting a new world, you can find world seeds online that create worlds with many taiga biomes. Forest also work but as of 1.13 (Ocean update) there is a couple of seeds to choose from. In Creative mode, you can spawn a wolf anywhere. If you are an Operator you could summon one. The command for this is /summon minecraft:wolf .

steps.title: Equip the bones.
steps.content: Equip the bones. When you hold a bone, wolves will usually move toward you. Be very careful not to click on the wolf, or all surrounding wolves may attack you.

steps.title: Press the tame button until the wolf is tamed.
steps.content: Press the tame button until the wolf is tamed. A Tame button will appear. Press this button, and you'll use up a bone and have a chance to tame the wolf. Ashes floating above the wolf means the attempt was unsuccessful. Hearts and a collar means that you've tamed the wolf. This will often take 3â€“6 tries. It can take more if you're unlucky. Also, instead of pressing the tame button you could hold down on the wolf but this is more risky as a fail would result as the wolves swarming you. Be very careful to click the Tame button and not the wolf. It's easy to click the wolf accidentally and turn it hostile.

steps.title: Tell it to sit or stand.
steps.content: Tell it to sit or stand. Your dogs will follow you around until you move your character's hand over them and press the Sit button that appears. Hover over them again and press Stand to make them move again. Once again, holding down works

steps.title: Bring them along to protect you.
steps.content: Bring them along to protect you. Dogs will attack most enemies once the enemy has hurt you, or once you hurt the enemy. They will not attack certain types of enemies, such as creepers or guardians. Axolotl can be used for underwater fights as cats are good for creeper fights. (as of 1.17 - Caves & Cliffs update.)

steps.title: Feed the dog to heal it.
steps.content: Feed the dog to heal it. As a dog takes damage, it lowers its tail. Equip a piece of meat (of any kind) and feed it to the injured dog to heal it. Even rotten meat will work. Also, You cannot feed a dog bones. They only work on wild wolves.

steps.title: Dye your dog's collar.
steps.content: Dye your dog's collar. You can dye your dog's collar by hovering over it with dye in hand and pressing the Dye button on your screen. You can find dye ingredients in treasure chests. Dyes can be made from plants. White is bonemeal, black is wither roses or ink sacks

steps.title: Breed two dogs by feeding them.
steps.content: Breed two dogs by feeding them. Once you've tamed two wolves, bring them to the same location. Feed a piece of meat to each one by equipping the meat and hovering over the dog. Once both dogs have eaten, hearts will appear over their head. They will approach each other and a young dog will appear. The young dog is already tamed and its collar is red.
